a.g: Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?
[Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,
Working [hard] and exhausted.
They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
Then look at their food, which is the Zaqqum (Zaqqum) as Allah the Exalted said: 'Then indeed you, O those astray (al-Dalun) and deniers (al-Mukadhibun), will eat from a tree of Zaqqum (Zaqqum) and fill your bellies from it, then drink on top of it from boiling water (al-Hamim), drinking like thirsty camels (al-Him).' And He the Exalted said: 'Indeed it is a tree that emerges from the base of Hell (al-Jahim), its fruit as if it were heads of devils (al-Shayatin). Then indeed they will eat from it and fill their bellies from it, then indeed for them upon it is a mixture of boiling water (Hamim), then indeed their return is to Hell (al-Jahim).' And He the Exalted said: 'They will roast (Tasla) in a blazing fire (Naran Hamiyah), given drink from a boiling spring (Aynin Aniyah).' And He the Exalted said: 'Indeed with Us are shackles (Ankalan) and Hell (Jahiman) and food with choking (Ghusatan) and painful punishment (Adhaban Aliman).' And Ibn Abbas said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'If a drop of Zaqqum (Zaqqum) were dripped into the seas of the world, it would corrupt the livelihoods of the people of the world, so how about one whose food is that?'

a.g: They will be given drink from a boiling spring.
For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant
Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
And Abu al-Darda' said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Hunger is cast upon the people of the Fire until it equals what they are in of punishment, so they cry out for food and are given food from dhari' (a thorny, bitter plant) that does not fatten nor satisfy from hunger (la yusminu wa la yughni min ju'in). And they cry out for food and are given food that causes choking, so they remember how they used to pass choking in the world with drink, so they cry out for drink and boiling water is raised to them with iron hooks. When it approaches their faces, it scorches their faces, and when the drink enters their bellies, it cuts what is in their bellies. So they say: Call the keepers of Hell. He said: So they call the keepers of Hell to call your Lord to lighten for us a day of the punishment. They say: Did not your messengers come to you with clear proofs? They say: Yes. They say: So call, and the call of the disbelievers is only in error. He said: So they say: Call Malik. So they call and say: O Malik, let our Lord decide for us. He said: So He answers them: You are abiding.'

a.g: And cushions lined up
And carpets spread around.
Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created?
And at the sky - how it is raised?
And at the mountains - how they are erected?
And at the earth - how it is spread out?
So remind, [O Muhammad]; you are only a reminder.
You are not over them a controller.
However, he who turns away and disbelieves -
Then Allah will punish him with the greatest punishment.
Indeed, to Us is their return.
Then indeed, upon Us is their account.
